caption: The food was excellent and so was the sake! The people at my table started to feel uncomfortable towards the end because of their lack of social distancing. My birthday party accommodations were good up to 630pm. Then the restaurant got crowded and they tried to seat everyone that came through the door, eventhough they gave us such a hard time about our reservation. Once their business started to pick up, the service started to suffer and was lacking from there on out. Our server was seen far and few in between and we had to keep seeking him out. The tables and parties were sat too close together and although there were signs at each table about mask wearing at the table at all times unless you are eating or drinking and if you get up to use restroom for example, these rules weren't enforced. Patrons treated the mask wearing mandate as mearly a suggestion.
This place is really great and we come here every year on Valentine's Day. It is a special place and I really like this restaurant.

Being a month away from my birthday, I was looking for a spot to host a small gathering of close friends. I discovered Perry's Restaurant, a multi-level restaurant that serves Japanese fare, sushi, and specialty cocktails. They offer happy hour from 4-6pm daily. They have a nice rooftop bar with heated lamps. Reservations are encouraged. However, walk-ins are accepted.  You have to go up two long flights of stairs to get to the rooftop. I'll admit the second flight of stairs was a bit too steep. I'm glad I wasn't wearing high heels or had too many drinks.  Most of my friends ordered beers. Since I'm not a beer drinker, I decided to get the Zentini, which consisted of vodka, ginger infused sake, and agave pomegranate juice shaken and served in a champagne coupe and garnished with a lemon. It was light, fruity, and refreshing. I also ordered the Harasu Hako Sushi, which consisted of sushi rice topped with seared salmon belly, ikura, micro greens, and savory aioli sliced into six pieces and served with sushi ginger and wasabi. Every bite was delicious. I'd definitely return when indoor dining is resumed or the weather is warmer, whichever comes first, to try their other dishes!

Food was great and covid protocol was well done (plenty of space from other tables). Really loved the bento box, but I was missing the tsukemono and tamagoyaki. Rolls and nigiri were also delicious and server was great.
Great service. Fresh sushi

Perry’s is hands down my favorite sushi place in the city. And I’ve tried a lot of the sushi DC has to offer. They do just about everything well—from their rolls to their nigiri to their hot plates. We easily go twice a month. The service is amazing, prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere on the rooftop bar can’t be beat. During Covid, they have been following precautions to the letter and made us feel very comfortable. Highly recommend the Chesapeake roll and their white wine sangria!!
My favorite! The roles and the noodles are the best around.  They are very accommodating and the GM/waiter Darren is very professional and couldn't have been nicer!!  Can't wait to go back!!

Great food, atmosphere, and rooftop. Nothing really to view while on the roof but they spruced it up with lights and decor to still make it an interesting place. Definitely suggested as a spot to hit up when in the area with availability to bar hop down Adams Morgan too.
I’ve received the wrong order one too many times.

Such a lovely experience last night, friday night on the rooftop. Its been awhile since I was last in DC and I havent been out to eat in a restaurant since Covid began- so I really appreciated how safe and precautious the staff was. They were so friendly and courteous, it was very memorable. The food was excellent- super fresh. The rooftop is just so gorgeous- they definitely had a couple of hiccups and handled it gracefully. And the host was so sweet, really made us feel at home. Looking forward to going back!
Another phenomenal experience

Incredible poor customer service of the hostes and all people from the first floor, it's like they see you there, but just don't care about you and you'll be waiting long enough that you'll decide to better leave. Food it's expensive and not so delicious
The food was good, the staff was so friendly too, great service 👍☺️

Sushi was absolutely fantastic but the service could have been better. We wanted to order a second round of drinks and more food but no one came by our table for a half an hour and when they did they told us our time was up at our table. We tried a large majority of the sushi rolls and were not disappointed - we will definitely be back!

Probably the worst meal I had during RW 2020. The appetizer was literally a single chip with a drop of wasabi hummus on top. Shameful. The sushi itself was just fine, nothing out of the ordinary. The mango crepe cake was probably the best part of the meal yet also forgettable. Wouldn't go back, especially considering the many excellent restaurants in AdMo.  Update: looking at the RW menu, it was clear that the wasabi chip came across as the appetizer because the restaurant forgot to add the actual appetizer to our bag! We only received the sushi platter, mango crepe cake (which is what we received despite it being listed as a yuzu cheesecake), and wasabi chip. I appreciate the response, but it doesn't change the fact that the experience was a let down.

Amazing food. From the appetizers, to the cocktails, main course, the bento boxes, the desert. All so good. And really friendly service and good safety protocols and social distancing in place. The shumai and poke were amazing for the appetizers, and the cheesecake for desert is a must try!
The food is really good here and the deserts are very refreshing. Would recommend trying this place out.

Sushi selection was refreshing and beautifully displayed especially paired with their cocktails. Must try the Yuzu Cheesecake! Main dishes would benefit from more unique array to compete against the ever growing Japanese cuisine growing in DC.

Ordered pick up for Restaurant week and were extremely disappointed. Tiny portions, sushi and sashimi were good but the teriyaki stake and fried chicken were cold and flavorless... overpriced and just not worth it

I'll echo the other comments about very poor service and unprofessional staff. I placed a takeout order and put cash tip to make sure the staff would actually get to keep it, but when I went to pick up my order the instructions had written "NO TIP!!!!!!" with a bunch of angry faces. I didn't want to trust the food after a place felt comfortable acting like that and ended up tossing it. No way I would ever consider going here again.
The foods from this Japanese restaurant taste like Korean foods.

So I’ll start by saying I have no intention of eating here ever again, but will add that I’m not trying to be disproportionately harsh just honest. The food was solid, but not amazing. I think most people will be happy with the food and I ate my fair share. Where I was most disappointed was the service. Part of our order came out wrong as the dish was suppose to be prepared with tempura flakes throughout it. When I noticed the discrepancy they brought a cup of flakes and simply poured it on top. This is not the service that I expect when paying over $100+ for sushi.  Lastly, we arrived at our reservation time of 7 PM and had finished eating about an hour later. My date wanted to order one additional Prosecco when we were told that we couldn’t order anymore due to a time constraint (that we were not notified of when we arrived). I brought to their attention that there were not only tables available, but 5 tables who had arrived before us that they had said nothing to. I’m fine with policies, as long as they are enforced equitably. I decided that I didn’t want to give them anymore of my money re: the Prosecco and left. Also, that I just wouldn’t be back.
I had sushi delux and Harasu roll at the rooftop which were really good. Servers and all works in there were very kind with smile. It will be my fav restaurant in DC ever and highly recommend.
Hands down our favorite restaurant in all DC. The food and staff are wonderful. Highly recommended.
Great location - love the upstairs outdoor bar views, but we decided to eat downstairs. Nice sushi, ramen other options - decent prices!

My first trip there. We had a group of 12 and had a blast. I couldn't believe the length of the buffet line. There was a wide variety of food, and all decently done. I was probably most surprised by the fried chicken. It was like popcorn shrimp, except it was chicken, and tastier than expected. I tried a piece while serving myself just to make sure. Staff was good and the "ladies" gave it their all. The music was lively, costumes good, and performances appropriately exaggerated. A nice surprise was the Emcee calling out special occasions and individually addressing each person. A great time was had by all.
Great Sunday Brunch.
Nice ambiance, very good food,and very friendly staff

This is an excellent upscale restaurant for first dates or group gatherings. The service is great, but not so fast as if you feel like you’re being rushed out.  The appetizers (fried tofu, charred avocado, edamame) are yummy, although they do taste *interesting* to an American palate.  The sushi is excellent, but since I’m vegetarian, I can’t speak on the fish rolls. However, my good friend enjoyed his salmon rolls so I think they’re a good choice.  What to know: the appetizers are more interesting than the sushi; huge wine/ whisky/ sake list; and the atmosphere is more romantic than casual.  We visited on a weekday, so we didnt need a reservation, but I could imagine Perry’s getting quite busy during the weekend.
The best

Best sushi place in DC. I love this place and visit it often. They have a great selection of food and beverages. The staff are super helpful and the outdoor rooftop patio is amazing during a nice day.

Outstanding experience. On a visit to DC to see a friend, thought it would be nice to check out an old haunt from 25+ years ago. Dinner on the roof deck was lovely. The food was good. The highlight of the night was our server Ilan...kind, genuine, friendly. Thanks for a lovely night with an old friend !
I tried this spot once with a friend and I am addicted ever since. I love the great atmosphere and tasty food and beverages. I recommend this place.
Neat place. The food is amazing!! Staff was so friendly. Lover it!!
We went for restaurant week and were blown away. Absolutely delicious food, great service, and delightful atmosphere. We'll definitely be back.
Decent food!

My friends and I had a phenomenal experience at Perry's Drag Brunch today.  The food was excellent (served buffet style) and there was a good selection of breakfast and lunch options as well as sweet, savory and salads.  The coffee was good and the drinks (a separate charge) all sounded interesting (the regular mimosa was nice).  The entertainment was phenomenal.  There were multiple queens who all performed and wandered around the tables.  They had cash on hand for change to tip the queens.  Great for a birthday, anniversary, wedding whatever.  They call out those with special events and give them extra attention.  There were plenty of people both young and old, male and female.  Bring everyone!
Had a superb time here with a couple of friends during happy hour. Great sushi and lovey staff.
Perry’s drag brunch is Sunday service!!!!
I always enjoy Perry’s.
Expensive. Small portions chocolate cake bread pudding was a stale chocolate cupcake.
Great food, good service, awesome view! Happy Hour at the bar is a good value!
Great view from the rooftop and delicious food
(Translated by Google) Good atmosphere restaurant like  (Original) ร้านบรรยากาศดีชอบครับ
Good sushi great views.
Good buffet to boot
Some of the best staff in the DC area!  They also pay a lot of attention to your food preferences and in recommending food that genuinely fit your taste. Great place to go out to eat at!

We (me and my girlfriend) live close by and visit this place often. Our recent visit though, was surprisingly unpleasant. We reserved a table for 4. As we invited our friends, 3 of us came on time, one was a bit late. We've been told 4th person can't join the party if came later. In other words, we either had to wait 4th guest to get seated, or be party of 3. Attitude of the hostesses were quite unfriendly and no proper explanation were given.  Our server "Best" (this is her name) was very professional and happy to welcome us again. She is the only reason for 2 stars.
Great place, with good quality food
Chill rooftop bar, good selection of Japanese food beyond sushi. Fabulous drag brunch on weekends.

This waa my first time here and they did great. Prompt service, clean tables,  kind employees. I arrived a little after my friend and he was seated with water. It was easy to find him as this place is not packed in too tight with tables and chairs. My only concern was the noise but it was not the fault of the business. I got the wild mushroom fried rice and miso soup side. VERY GOOD! I will have return and try the other vegetarian options.
Oh so wonderful. A main stay in Adams Morgan. Plus, their superb afable GM, Justin just mad the experience complete. 10/10 would recommend
So so so good!!!
The drag brunch was awesome. The food was good, and the show was not only fun, but uplifting!
Rooftop sushi and professional cocktails. Best view in Adams Morgan. Do it.

We found this place while we were wondering around Dupont Circle. There was roof top seating so we thought we would check it out. This was on a Friday night and when we got up there it was a very young crowd at the bar, and a minimum of $15 to sit at a table, we thought we were just going to have a drink and leave so we went back down to the inside bar but after looking over the menu we ordered spicy tuna rolls and crunchy shrimp rolls, both were delicious, then we ordered fish tacos and pork belly on a stick,  the fish tacos were great, the pork belly wasn't quite as good as the rest of the food, plus most everything was happy hour prices. Our bartender was Devon, he was fabulous. We would definitely go back there if we're ever up in DC again in the Dupont Circle area.

I loved this place. We went and sat on the roof during one of the beautiful days we had this spring. Our server, Ivan, was the perfect balance of attentive and not overbearing. He was knowledgeable about the menu and made several recommendations. The space on the roof can't be beat during a nice day.  The sushi platter my wife got was really good and had an interesting variation in the fish. My skewers were good, but a bit small. Also, the beef skewer was made with hanger steak and when you cook steak that small, you inevitably overcook it a bit and hanger doesn't hold up very well to that, it gets a bit chewy. The pork belly was delicious though.  We shared a bottle of sake and they treated us to a dessert (we were there for a personal milestone celebration).  We'll definitely be back!
The most fun ever! Have brunch, pitchers of mimosas, and enjoy the show!  DON'T MISS IT!
Love the sushi at Perry's.
Went for cocktails on the rooftop. Service was surly by one bartender and super friendly by another, hence the average rating.

I attended their Drag Queen brunch for mother's day.  It was an amazing show and would recommend.  Warning, this brunch is only suited for those looking to have a good time with more people ready to have a good time.  Bad attitudes are not welcome.  Buffet style food was delicious and full of many options for everyone.  I'd love to come back and try Perry's standard restaurant food.  The restaurant is on the second floor.
Very cool rooftop and great food!
Not only is the show awesome, but the food is actually good too! I’d definitely go back.
Had an amazing time!
Very good sushi. Enjoyed the rooftop outside.
Great rooftop dining
Great Happy hour deals.
This was the best sushi restaurant in DC that I've been to.
The Japanese food is not so good. The food served during drag brunch is great though, and the drag shows are awesome.
Went up to the rooftop for drinks. Really awesome spot. Great drinks. Friendly bartender.

Food was ok a lot of small plates that are reasonably priced (I guess). Side note I really enjoyed their lemonade and miso soup which I didn't take a picture of(sorry). Definitely a place you take a Car service to get to. You don't want to necessarily drive parking is normally terrible( meter parking or pay to park parking lots).
The drag brunch is awesome.

Drag brunch was the most entertaining and uplifting experience of my weekend. The Queens were entertaining and uplifting. It was a very positive, affirming experience...the queens were absolutely amazing. The food was incredible too....great variety and excellent culinary experience. I can’t wait to come back!

I'd call this 3.5 stars. Pretty good Japanese place with a diverse menu. Great for a drink or happy hour, and good for dinner. It's a large space that was not very busy on a Thursday night. Everything we ate was decent-to-good: the seaweed salad was pretty standard, the chicken kara-age appetizer was good (although not huge), the grilled hamachi entree was delicious, and the sushi was decent. Service was attentive, friendly, and helpful! Prices are reasonable although would probably add up if you tried to make a meal of the smaller plates. Most of the food didn't blow our socks off, but it was good enough that, combined with easy table availability, great service, and reasonable prices we would happily eat here again when in the neighborhood. Only complaint I had is that the restaurant had kind of a musky smell when I walked in, but I eventually stopped noticing it.
Thank you for hosting such a lovely evening!  Everything was delicious and the service was excellent.
Lot of fun! But they pack you very hard to get your food and get back to your seat
Great time!!!  Disappointed i cant give more than 5 stars.
Excellent happy hour, food selection and alcohol are great.  Value and price point are perfect for a stop.  Service was fast and drinks are well made.  Highly recommend a try

Sunday brunch is EVERYTHING!!!! Banging food, Banging show. I took the new boyfriend, told him I knew a Great brunch spot and made a reservation. He was very suprised to say the least, but a good enough sport and he agreed the food was on good.

I have been to Perry's twice now for the Sunday Drag Brunch.  If you haven't been you need to go it's so much fun.  The food is really good and the performers are fantastic!  I can't say enough about what a great time you'll have!
Went for the drag bunch show so wasn't expecting much from brunch buffet, but food and show was fabulous!
(Translated by Google) Nice show if you like the drug queens but bad food!  (Original) Spettacolo carino se piacciono i drug queen ma cibo pessimo!
Their rooftop is awesome! Did not eat there so cannot comment on the food, but the cocktails were great
Amazing brunch and drag show every Sunday!!!

I have visited this place on many occasions. Whether eating alone or with your friends it doesn’t seem to disappoint. The sushi is always top quality and if you have a chance to sit on the rooftop it will make your night. If you make it in time for happy hour the special rolls are at their best prices. Only set back is the wait for food on a Friday or Saturday can take some time but that is expected at a spot that is so jammed pack. Overall great restaurant and never disappoints.
Great sushi. Lovely rooftop bar w a view of the city.

Kinda just stumbled onto this place. Wanted to get some sushi. Had no idea they had roof top level. Very nice. Food was great, although we only ordered sushi. Price was right in my opinion considering the setting. Nice place for an evening drink or dinner date.
Who doesn’t love a Perry’s night?! Great sushi. Never disappoints.
Oh my gosh. Their Dragshow brunch is amazing! For anyone, male or female, looking for a great Sunday Funday- this is the place to be!
Did the rooftop happy hour. Excellent views. Service and food were very good.
Such a great brunch. We have been a few times now and each time gets better. Totally recommend this place.
The food is disappointing but the view and the rooftop make up for it.
I've had better sushi, the roof top is nice and I guess that's the highlight of this place
The rooftop is great and has and amazing view. Great to be used in summer!
On a nice evening, you'd have to be crazy to miss out on the rooftop. Caution, stairs leading up are shallow and steep. Not a problem going up, but coming down after a few too many would be dicey.
fabulous rooftop. delicious sushi and main plates. sunday drag brunch is interesting.
(Translated by Google) They are talkative and hard-working  (Original) Son habables y muy trabajadores

We got married at Perry's last month and could not have been happier with that choice! Perry's made sure that the night was everything we had hoped for. Sarah, the event planner, is wonderful! She is incredibly organized, responsive, and thorough. We threw a lot of requests at her, and she worked hard to make sure that they were all fulfilled. She went above and beyond to make the space beautiful for our wedding and was thoughtful about every detail. She helped mollify everyone's day-of stresses and discretely managed all the complicated details of the event so that the evening flowed seamlessly. She even took a few photos and a video that captured great moments that wouldn't have been captured otherwise. The other members of the Perry's staff were wonderful as well. The hosts, servers, and bartenders were all super fast, professional, friendly, and accommodating. And, the cooks were fabulous too; many guests told us that it was the best wedding food they had every had. A big thanks and applause to Perry's!!!
Perry's has great rooftop dining. My only dissatisfaction was the noise level, which was too loud.  Why do people shout at each other?
Wow! Great sushi! Wonderful rooftop restaurant!

The food was HORRIBLE.....the service was even worse. The only thing good about this place is the rooftop, literally just the rooftop,  not the bar, or the cramped seating.  I got up to leave, and the table busters threw my entire to go box away within 2 minutes. It was an entire Sushi Roll!!! When I asked for a replacement or refund, the GM and waitress had an attitude and said no to the refund and that they could get me a cheaper Sushi replacement.  I asked why the table guys threw my food away without checking with anyone, and he said "its called efficiency"

Food was unique for sure. Great atmosphere and great service. The waiter Tan talked me through sake choices (my first time) and was very attentive all throughout. I got the chicken tara-age and it was delicious; just know that you're not coming here for a plate piled high with mouth-watering comfort food. Some of the vegetables that came with the dish were an acquired taste and I can understand why some might not like it.

I had a lovely experience at Perry's last night. I went with my roommate and a friend because the three of us were collectively celebrating a raise and a new job. We had a really tasty dinner - great cocktails and delicious sushi. The service was admittedly a little slow, but our server was wonderful and so kind and helpful. And as he brought the check to us (and apologized for the service, which really wasn't worth apologizing for), he brought us three complimentary glasses of champagne! It was a lovely touch on a great meal, in a beautiful setting (up on the roof). My one ask would be to turn the music down just a touch. It's fine at the bar but is a little obtrusive at 8 or 9, at a weeknight dinner on the roof.  All in all - bravo, Perry's. Lovely dining experience.

username: Eve's Bela Dona Fan Page Barnett

caption: I came here for the drag brunch on Sunday. I was celebrating my birthday with a close friend. I had a fantastic time start to finish here. The queens were on point and extremely friendly - no attitudes here. The food was excellent and as part of the show, the host welcomed everyone celebrating something to the front of the room and basically showered each individual with a little love depending on their story. All in all, I was entertained, I was loved, and most importantly - I was well-fed.
The rooftop bar is the best in...well, at least blocks around. Go there if you want a good view and don't mind the youth scene.
I've been here many times for happy hour or dinner. And I've been pleased everytime.  The food has been superb. My go-to sushi role is the Element.
Great drag brunch!
I went for the drag show brunch with my girlfriends and I had a blast!!! If you like brunch and drag shows, you have to try Perry's at least once
Great roof top place. Yummy sushi!
Very entertaining! Enjoyed the show thoroughly!
Great place
My recent visit to Perry's was for their Sunday drag brunch. My group and I had a great time. The food was good and the entertainment so much fun.

My friends and I experienced the drag brunch for the first time and it did not disappoint! The waitstaff was extremely friendly and the performers were amazing! We also thought the food was extremely good with lots of options! We will be coming back soon!
Would eat forever
One of the best sushi restaurants :)
Wonderful rooftop in Adams Morgan, DC
Best unagi/eel I've ever had
Service was above and beyond! The food was delicious! A perfect place for a date or drink and sushi to share with friends.
My favorite- salmon sashimi, theirs was very good quality
Good sushi, pleasantly relaxed, a bit weird with the dance music blaring from the speakers.

I met a few friends here at the rooftop bar for a drink before heading to dinner. I had one glass of Merlot and closed my tab. When I checked my bank account few days later I had been charged twice: one $9 charge and one $13 charge. That same evening one of my friends was also double charged and also only had a single glass of wine. We were intentionally charged twice, with two separate amounts which is enough evidence for me that the bartender did it entirely on purpose. I will not return.

My husband and i stopped in to drop off a gift at a going away party for a friend and were not disappointed! We were only there for a short time but will deffinatly be back because the food on the brunch buffet looks amazing! Can not wait for the experience! While i have never seen anyone in drag before it was so much fun and i love it! Can not wait to go back!
Drag brunch was amazing.
The drag brunch was a riot. We had so much fun, and ended up willingly giving them all our cash. Food is okay, the experience is excellent.
Happy hour on the roof! (Only at the bar)
Awesome small dishes. Friendly staff!
Amazing food and night!
The greatest Sunday Drag Brunch
Great cocktails, solid sushi and an awesome rooftop.
Great view, poor beer selection but good wine options.
Thanks for a great first time Drag Brunch experience. Show was good. Waiters were great.
Great food. The food was outstanding and while I found the waiter not ideal I still think that 5 stars are deserved.
Drag brunch was pretty awesome! Drinks were somewhat expensive but the buffet was incredible and very reasonably priced. The show was very entertaining, definitely would recommend.

Star for ambience and a star for the cool cocktails, but the hostess on the roof won't seat anyone who gona drink from the bar unless you finish it. There were plenty of tables and the wait staff was hanging around, but she still refused to seat anyone if they had gotten a drink at the bar!  So if you grab a drink and you are hungry you had better plan on eating at the crammed bar or slamming your drink.
Great food! The bar and drink service was way too slow. We had empty drink glasses for 15 min .

One of my favorite roof top resturants in the city.  I normally come here for the sushi.  I love having sushi and drinks with friends here.  The view is nice and on a warm evening it is magical with the lights and the atmosphere.  I highly recomend coming here on a date or with a group of friends you don't see to often because it is a very impressive rooftop! The rest of the resturnat is wonderful as well but I cannot stop raving about the roof.
Beautiful rooftop, delicious crudo, rolls were ok & steak skewer spice was delicious! Phenomenal for sunset!

Hate to be giving Perry's less than five stars but it isn't what it used to be. This was one of my favorite restaurants in the DC area 5-6 years ago and it's declined in quality and service, particularly in the last year.  Staff now wear jeans and flannel, which feels misplaced at an establishment that's often attended for special occasions and date nights. Had a couple of confusing experiences with apparent team serving at the sushi bar, not sure if I was actually being attended to by more than one server or if staff just didn't know who was serving me. Drinks are inconsistent, even ordering the same cocktail twice during dinner can yield two different beverages. During a recent meal on the roof, service was very slow (30+ mins for sushi, and everything came out at once - seaweed salad and crudo appeared with the sushi and rolls we'd expected later in the meal). Prices have increased seemingly without reason; on multiple visits have had some items that were "fishier" than is desirable.  Some gems remain; standout menu items include the hangar steak skewers,  hamachi crudo, element roll, and the hamachi collar if it's on offer. The rooftop continues to be one to beat - you can't make reservations specifically for the roof, but come early and with luck you'll be able to sit down and enjoy one of the most romantic locations in Adams Morgan. Here's hoping Perry's can turn things around and reclaim its high ranking on my list of favorites!
Good food, great rooftop, nice atmosphere, but the waiter is not nice at all, staff is a bit rude.
Cozy and good food.
Super fun sunday brunch. It never gets old. And the performers are some of the most hardworking women I've ever met!

The sushi was not good and the service was horrible. We were there for nearly three hours, an hour of that was waiting for our order to be taken and then another hour to get our check. We weren't offered refills of water or more drinks. We wanted this place to be great, which is why we didn't leave before our order was taken. We will not return.
Totally fun place!! Been there for Sunday brunch with DQs and loved it. Cannot think of any moment i spent without lmao. Hilarious and entertaining. Two fat thumbs up for the girls!!
Loved the sushi!
I've only been for the Drag Brunch on Sundays. It's amazing. I've gone multiple times and will continue to go. The brunch is great. No complaints from this girl! 😄

A huge thank you to all the ladies who gave us such a wonderful show yesterday (2 April 2017). We had a wonderful time . This birthday celebration cannot be topped! The food was very tasty,too. From the 77 year old who won the twerking contest !!
Great food! Great rooftop dining!
Good sushi and cocktails.
Justine is simply the best! Great service with nice Japanese food
V. Good

Service was terrible. We got seated right away but then ignored for 20 minutes. We would have just left but we were starving and I had told them when I made the reservation we were celebrating my wife's birthday. When we finally did get to order it took another hour to get our food. The table next to us complained more than once. The sushi rolls were tiny for the price which may have been acceptable if the quality was wonderful but it wasn't. Truly disappointing for such a long wait for mediocre food and to leave hungry. Skip it. We will go somewhere else.

The service was absolutely terrible.  Our waitress ghosted us for the first half hour until the bartender had to come take over.  We were there for an hour before our appetizers even came out.  The drinks were prepared poorly also.

Perry is one of our FAVORITE RESTAURANTS!! Me and my husband got married at Perrys on december 2016, it was a wonderful beautiful wedding!! We were struggling finding a nice, good restaurant to have our wedding, reception and ceremony until we found Perry. Not only they were permitting us to have our wedding there, the manager Sarah said she can help us decorating with the wedding decorations, put music. No restaurant wanted to help us, just wanted to give the place for wedding, give food and that's it. On Perry not only they were providing the place and food but also the manager was helping me and my husband like a wedding coordinator, that's amazing!! She is so nice, she decorated our wedding with our decorations, we only had to worry to show up and that's it and she will do the rest. Sarah and everybody was so nice and helpful and profesional in our wedding. She put our dream song Final Fantasy song for our ceremony, it was beautiful. The emplyees helped me too during tbe ceremony, they were all super nice and very helpful. We met owner of the place too, very nice man. Sarah and everybody made our dream wedding come true. I am so happy and lucky me and my husband found a great, beautiful place for our wedding. We LOVE the food there, the steak, chicken, desserts especially the green tea tiramisu are super delicious!! You gotta try it out!! It was the perfect wedding, our decorations next to thier chirstmas decorations, it looked so pretty, like a dreamland or a fairy tale. Thank you everybody on Perrys Restaurant!! Perry Restaurant is a marvelous restaurant, with happy employees, cozy environment like being in a happy home, I highly recommend it to go eat, have a good time or have your wedding!!  Estefania and Michael
Fine dining experience with great food and fantastic ambience.
GO FOR THE SUNDAY DRAG BRUNCH!  The food is fabulous and the entertainment even more so!
Japanese restaurant by night, drag queen brunch by morning. Try to sit out on the rooftop patio in the summer if you're going for dinner, it's beautiful.

My wife and I held our wedding here. We couldn't be happier with the event. The food was fantastic and the staff were so nice and helpful throughout the entire process. The venue itself was warm and cozy. It felt like a large welcoming family room. We haven't been back for normal dinner yet but we definitely will be!
We love Perry's! Consistently good food and cocktails, either on the lovely rooftop on a warm evening, of in the comfy interior dining space. Friendly staff, and a definite favourite of ours :)
Incredibly friendly team. Delicious sushi.
Great service
Great happy hour specials on drink and food. Also had a delicious dinner 👍
I had Sunday brunch with my friends here and it was a wonderful experience.
Amazing sushi

I really like Perry's. It has the best moderately priced sushi in the city, at least that I've found. The small plates are all delicious. The burger, which I wasn't planning on getting until our waiter recommended it, definitely exceeded my expectations. The donburi dishes are also great. Plus, they have a great rooftop.
Great food, great service and did I say great food!
Loved the Sunday morning drag brunch!

3 stars because of the rooftop. Otherwise consistent medicocracy:  Con:  - Slow staff (does not apply to the friendly bus boys/girls) - head waiters love to instruct - overpriced chirashi bowl with really lousy sushi rice but decent sashimi. Nevertheless nowhere near worth the $30 price tag  Head to Sushi Taro or Sushi Capitol for better fish. Unless you want the Adams Morgan view at all cost.

Such a horrible experience. We had booked a table for 3. Two of us arrived on time but one friend was a bit late. Although the place was empty and we already wanted to order some food, we were not allowed to seat. Once we were , we felt completely rushed. They brought the check while ending our food and checked twice if we had left the credit card. Once paid, but still with wine in our glasses, we were "invited" to finish at the bar and liberate the table. That was simply too much. We felt rushed all the time we spent there, with that horrible US restaurants of treating you like a factory chain, trying to maximize table utility but ultimately killing the dine out experience. Never again this place
The food didn't inspire, but the rooftop atmosphere is great

Best sushi experience in town! And we just moved from Bangkok, Thailand, to DC so we have grown accustomed to some high quality standards when it comes to our sushi. It is nice to see new types of sushi being experimented with, which has often resulted in some interesting taste experiences. The manager is kind, the roof terrace is great when it is warmer. And inside has a nice atmosphere, with a gas fireplace for the colder days. Nice place, and we will surely be back.

Just ate here with a group of six and received terrible service. Waiter was entertaining and helpful, but unfortunately the restaurant ran out of basic ingredients and failed to inform us that our meals were going to be incredibly late to come out. All of the meals came out at different times, and we left with two of our meals to go after over an hour and a half of waiting. The two late meals were not taken off the check, and another table near to us had the same experience. The food, when it came out, was not bad, but the service was inexcusable. The manager was the least helpful person in the experience
Best drag brunch anywhere. Am I'm not just saying that because the fabulous Whitney GucciGoo is my child.
The food here is always extremely average, but the rooftop deck with the Christmas lights is a cut above for Adams Morgan.
I have been to this restaurant in the summer time when you can eat on the rooftop. It is a lovely atmosphere. I had a great sushi.

Horrific service. Rude manager/owner. We'd ordered a bunch of food and drinks, then asked the manager/owner if we could move from the bar to the dining area. He said he needs to make money to pay rent, then asked us to leave!
I like this place.  far quieter than the Union spot with a tad more newer look.  good foods, healthy servings with decent prices.

Drag brunch gives me life. Food is good enough for a bunch buffet but the girls  are amazing. They do not take reservations - you need to show up early and get your name on the list. Tip the girls if you want pics!

If you like pretentiousness restourants and rude service, you would greatly enjoy Perry's. The waiter was exceptionally rude, the music was obnoxious and the prices on the menu require a special bank loan. We left before placing an order, something we never did before. Keep posting reviews everybody. Together we can hasten the demise of places like Perry's and give our business to those who actually deserve it.

This is one of those places that you always hear good things about but until you experience you don't really understand what they mean.  The drag brunch here is one of the best I've been to in the world.  The performers are world class, the food quality is great and the drinks are mighty tasty.
Fun and unique place for brunch.  Food is fine, but the drag queen brunch is lots of fun.

Service was indifferent. We moved tables and they did not bring or replace the water. Salad had spoiled lettuce and the home fries were lukewarm. Outside of the nice outdoor setting this was a bad experience.
Rooftop is a great place for Happy Hour, the Sushi is ok and the Drag Brunch is hilarious.

The meal and service were absolutely fantastic, neither of us will forget this meal.  Perry's kushiyaki skewers were all cooked perfectly and Chef's house-made teriyaki sauce is AMAZING!!!  My husband ordered some sushi and rolls based on our fantastic server's suggestions and Perrys has the BEST sushi IMO and we have been to just about every sushi restaurants in DMV.  Every single item was delicious and creative. Oh, and props to their staff.  Our server explained each dish and was very attentive, drinks were delicious.

Fantastic place.  From great food and top notch sushi to attentive servers and bartenders, My wife and I left this restaurant satisfied.  Will return soon, definitely during Spring/Summer when their rooftop bar/dining opens back up.
A wonderful experience, awesome sushi, delicious food, great staff, unforgettable rooftop views. I'll be back for more.

The food was great. I enjoyed it.  Our waiter John was great.  He was a good conversationist. Had a lot of jokes and a lot of recommendations on what she should try, if we wanted to try something new.  I had been to Perry's a few times but I brought a few friends with me from out of town who have never been to this establishment.  He was very helpful and they all enjoyed their dish.  The atmosphere was good also.  I especially loved the meat, it was just right.  It was tender & juicy.  The sushi was alright, being as i'm not a sushi guy I can't say if it's excellent or not but it was definitely good. I will definitely be back to this restaurant hopefully sooner rather than later. I definitely recommend this spot to everyone, put it on your list of places to eat at if you're in the DMV.

What a wonderful place for Sunday Brunch birthday celebration for my sister's birthday. I had a great time and the food was excellent. The selection of food was awesome. I love the pastries. The pasta dish was wonderful also.  The selection of meat was tender that it melt in your mouth. My sister, niece and her girlfriend had some much fun I was tried when I left.  It felt like a midday house party with family and friends. The sunday brunch is very special to take someone for fun and excitement. I will be back again and again when my friends and family come to visit me. Thank you Perry's staff for your excellent customer service with a wonderful smile.
I think the food here is fantastic, but it can be a bit inconsistent.  Better sushi than expected, given that it's...not a sushi place, really.
Awesome rooftop with bar.  Food so-so.
cozy and romantic, very nice to   have seating options from bar,   couches, sushi bar and outdoor   terrace.  sunday drag queen   brunch is a must.
